intro: Chamaesyce theriaca var. spurca, commonly known as the goatweed or spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and woodland edges. It has alternate, simple leaves that are often lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. The flowers are inconspicuous and are surrounded by modified leaves called bracts.
